"Help, MR2 is frozen while loading!" Semi-solution
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): "Help, MR2 is frozen while loading!" Semi-solution
By Anonymous on Monday, October 9, 2000 - 03:02 pm:

This is a work-around that I've found seems to take care of an infinite loading sequence in MR2.

Symptoms: Black "Loading..." screen, Mocchi continues to bounce, but the Playstation stops reading from the Monster Rancher 2 CD (you stop hearing the whirring sound) and the loading has continued for an unusually long time (If it's been 5 minutes, that's way too long).

Solution: WARNING - Opening up the CD platter while the Playstation is on is usually discouraged by any sort of official source, especially when it involves some sort of liability! Use this method at your own risk!
Press the "Open" button on your Playstation to stop the reading process, then close the lid again before the CD finishes spinning down. This forces the Playstation to start its "seek" process over again, which is usually where MR2 hangs for some reason. This kludge can also fix item shop hangs where the game locks up while trying to load the 3D model of an item.

By Phoenix Masta on Tuesday, October 10, 2000 - 08:10 am:

Also if this doesn't work don't forget to use a lens cleaning kit anon. I've had my Playstation take a turn for the worst and the lens cleaning kit made it work once more. be seein' ya
/0> ^-^ <0\

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, October 10, 2000 - 09:05 am:

Actually, the lens cleaning kit is really dangerous. Sony recommends that you never touch the the lens with anything. Even a slight amount of pressure can knock it out of alignment, causing it to not read CDs well, or, causing it to scratch your CDs. Saw a lot of people with problems like this in my store.

By Phoenix Masta on Wednesday, October 11, 2000 - 03:42 pm:

Well for me it was either a $15 cleaning kit or a $55 fix from Sony which would have taken weeks not seconds. I would rather take the chance. be seein' ya
/0> ^-^ <0\

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, October 11, 2000 - 05:30 pm:

One of our regular contributers here had his PSX start scratching all his discs really deeply after he used a cleaner. He lost several games before figuring it out...ouch!
